info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 20 at 4:23AM PST until February 22 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 10 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 12 inches. * WHERE...The Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades including Highway 140, Greensprings Highway, Interstate 5, and the Mount Ashland Ski Road. * WHEN...From 10 AM this morning to 10 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult, at times, due to slick, snow covered roads. Snowfall rates are likely to be greatest, at times, this afternoon and the Monday through Tuesday morning when they could reach a half an inch to 1 inch per hour. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Forecast snowfall amounts during the advisory period range from a foot along Highway 140 near Lake of the Woods, to 5 inches at Siskiyou Summit on Interstate 5, to around 10 inches on Mount Ashland. Additional snowfall will be possible Tuesday afternoon through Wednesday evening. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com or http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
